message:
Hello, junta! Here is the first article as a part of #CQ_Social_showoff by Kshitiz Khandelwal. I laughed my ass out reading this. May none of you experience what Mr.Kshitiz did😂.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1m-_RtMWfiIuL_VT7I9r-okUm3jjs-tFms3mvO3FxGsY/edit?usp=sharing

                                                                     Lavatory                                         anecdotal_humour

This happened to me on my first ever air trip to Mumbai. My dad wanted my first experience in flight to be the best, so he booked our tickets on a Jet Airways flight with a premium dinner. We were three, my mom's sister, my dad, et moi. Everything was going smoothly until a chocolate smoothie ruined my smooth flight experience. Three of them to be precise. We were served excellent dinner that day with a chocolate smoothie. Dad doesn't like chocolates, so he passed on his smoothie to the window seat. My mom's sister was afraid that the smoothie might add calories to her diet with her wedding in a fortnight in Mumbai for which we were onboard. She smoothly passed her smoothie to the window seat. I was sitting in the window seat. I quickly finished my dinner, slid my plate under the seat and looked with utmost desire at the three delicious chocolate smoothies. I savoured every single spoon of it which tasted unimaginably awesome.
I was looking out of the window while the chocolate did its thing. Slowly and steadily, as the chocolate smoothie found its way down my intestine, I had a sudden urge to take a dump. I controlled my urge until it was uncontrollable. I quickly rushed to the washroom and did my thing and here comes the climax, where is the water jet? Where in the world could they hide the most important sanitary device in that complicated western toilet? I looked around, checked all the drawers in the washroom but all in vain. I even realised that there was no water in the commode and felt that the aeroplane might be out of water due to which they removed the water jet too. I was an amateur, young and shy back then and most importantly a first-time air traveller. Back then, I didn't really know that some civilizations used to dry-wipe their bottoms. Moreover, the tissue roll was out of stock too. I could only see a few buttons on the side panel but I was afraid that one of them might alarm the pilots for an emergency landing. I was even afraid to press the flush button, but after a ten-minute long struggle, I finally prepared myself to take the risk. The flush button was the only mode of rescue left and I finally, after a lot of reluctance, pressed it. And boom, even the flush was a dry suction cleaner which very noisily pulled my poop into itself. Very very noisily which scared the shit out of me.
Having failed at a lot of things inside, I hurriedly knocked on the door and thankfully, the air hostess answered. I told her to call my dad as I needed some help. Dad was asleep so my aunt came to see what was wrong. I opened the door slightly and whispered into her ear about what was wrong, to prevent the gorgeous air hostesses from judging me. I even told my aunt to do something which does not involve the air hostesses so as to not get embarrassed. But alas! she didn't listen to me. She arranged for a couple of glass of water and gave them to me. I finally did my thing and shadily came out of the washroom with all the air hostesses looking at me weirdly. I gave a weird smile and rushed towards my seat as quickly as possible to see how my aunt narrated it to my dad who laughed at the way I gulped those chocolate smoothies. They were delicious though. And embarrassing.
Kshitiz Khandelwal                                        https://www.facebook.com/kshitiz.khandelwal.90

Ahoy junta!
Budding writers, interested artists, brilliant pun'ners, good-at-one-liner-ers and the versatile poets.
Literature is an art. It is the most beautiful way of expressing thoughts.

Are you one of those, who stashes up all your art work? Are you one of those, who is in dire need of audience, someone who thinks twice before posting on social media? Are you someone who seeks to improve by getting feedback for what you write?

Here we are, presenting you an amazing chance to showcase your brilliant pieces of art.
If it's dark or controversial, it can be anonymous (not a good idea).

Submit your works in the attached Google Drive link and let the world recognize you as a writer, poet or a humorous person.

Foot notes :
1. Mention your name and fb profile link at the end of your document so that we can give you the credits. 😃
2. Respect other people’s work and don't mess up the drive link.
3. Share a Google doc link with its sharing settings configured to only "commenting".

We will verify the works and publish them from our page.

Here's the link : 
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/13pUk6zywHSUoARjZVFYnHHfYHKixC7jX?usp=sharing

Ahoy junta!
Budding writers, interested artists, brilliant pun'ners, good-at-one-liners and the versatile poets.
Literature is an art. It is the most beautiful way of expressing the thoughts.
Are you one of those, who stashes up all your art work? Are you one of those, who is in dire need of audience, someone who thinks twice whether to post it or not on the social media; someone who seeks to improve by getting feedback for what you write?
Here we are, presenting you an amazing chance to share your art pieces.
If it's dark or controversial, it can be anonymous (not a good idea).
Submit your works in the attached Google Drive link and let the world recognize you as a writer, poet or a humorous person.

Communiqué IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post. “You can’t buy happiness but you can buy books and they are kind of the same thing” But what if you didn’t have to buy them? What if you could just share one and find a friend in return? IWG presents the event ‘Novel Exchange’ to set afoot this tradition. Let’s take this initiating step that’ll interweave Kgpian hearts. Come out with a book close to your heart which you’d like share and submit it. Receive another book that you’d like to read and enjoy. Meet the borrower or lender of your book to discuss it over a cup of chai or a walk around 2.2 and Congratulations, you now have two new friends! Nominate your booklover friends to come out and do the same, there’s no better way to get those introverts out of their rooms. Venue: Stalls in front of Gymkhana, CCD and MT Bring a Book: 5-7 pm ; 22nd August (Wednesday) Take a Book: 8-10 pm ; 23rd August (Thursday) Agreement: I hereby declare that I take full responsibility of taking care of the condition of this book and not tampering with it. I agree to return the book to its rightful owner by the third week of October. If I don’t meet the above requirements or lose the book by chance, I accept to face the consequences and return a sum of money chosen with propriety.

We know how excited and hyped up you are. Early days of KGP life are the best.
We know you guys are busy exploring all the new stuff that comes your way. Why not come to our Introductory Seminar?
Date : 6th of August. (MONDAY)
Time : 6PM.
Venue : Kalidas Auditorium.

Attention Pre-final year students!!
It's that time of an year now. The internships' buzz has begun. Communiqué, in association with ERUDITE is conducting Mock General Discussions and Personal Interview sessions. This is the best chance to know and correct your mistakes, as the experts test your inter-personal skills and a personalised feedback will be given by them. So gear up and meet us at the venue. The event will be held on 27th of July, in the Main Building. There is NO REGISTRATION FEE. Register before 27th, 5PM. GD slots will be given on 'first come, first serve' basis of registrations. 
Venue : F-244, Main Building.
Time : 6PM onwards.

Register at : tinyurl.com/cq-mockgd18

Get all your myths answered and know about various MS programs.
Date: 06:30AM
Time: 24-01-2018
Veunu: Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur (V4)
story: Communiqué IIT Kharagpur added an event.

message:
Communiqué in association with T.I.M.E. presents a seminar on GRE. Come and get all your myths cleared and queries answered about the application process and the various MS programmes.

Date: 24th January, Wednesday
Time: 6:30 - 8:30 PM
Venue: V4, Vikramshila Complex

Communiqué in association with T.I.M.E. presents a seminar on GRE. Come and get all your myths cleared and queries answered about the application process and the various MS programmes.

Date: 24th January, Wednesday
Time: 6:30 - 8:30 PM
Venue: V4, Vikramshila Complex

"Opportunities are like sunrise, If you wait too long, you miss them"

Are you still struggling to find your path in life, deciding your career, looking for opportunities? Communiqué is here with just what you need. As a part of Career Drive, We are conducting a seminar on "Non-Technical Career Opportunities after Engineering" by Mr. Vikash Goel. Mr. Vikash Goel is the Managing Director of Omnifin Solutions.  Be there to pave your future and grab the chance to be part of exciting projects offered by Omnifin Solutions requiring some programming skills.
The seminar will focus on :-

1) Entrepreneurship & Consulting
2) Diversity of roles in organisations
3) Approaching various case studies
4) Strategically drafting CVs 
5) Paid and certified projects on application of Artificial Intelligence

Details of the event :-

Date: 29th Oct'17
Day: Sunday
Venue: Vikramshilla, V3
Time: 5 pm onwards

#CareerDrive_2

Communiqué IIT Kharagpur in association with ERUDITE is organizing a soft skills workshop as a part of its Placement Drive for the final year students. 

Details of the event are -
Venue - F-244,Main Building

14th Oct, Saturday
6:00 pm - 7:30 pm - Seminar on Interview Skills
7:30 pm - 8:30 pm - Mock Interview Session
8:30 pm - 9:00 pm - Q/A round

15th Oct, Sunday
9:00 am - 10:00 am - Session on Body Language
10:00 am-12:00 pm - Mock GD's

Register at  tinyurl.com/placementdrive-17
PS: There is no registration fee.
Online Aptitude Test will be a take-home for students.

UG first year Induction Program and Communiqué present a certified course on Effective Communication Sessions by Dr. Ranbir Sinha. Dr. Sinha is a rocket scientist, an inventor, and an educator. He received his Bachelor of Technology degree in Aerospace Engineering from IIT Kharagpur, India and achieved the top merit position in the graduating class. Dr Sinha is fluent in 4 languages: English, Hindi, Bengali, and German. 

The sessions will be held from 7th to 11th of August. Former to these sessions, all the students are required to give a quick test to gauge their fluency and pronunciation through the link given below. This test also helps you identify the mistakes in your speech and helps you improve your communication. Students who score below 60% in this test are required to attend this course, those above 60% are also welcome for the same.

Link to the test: http://communique.iitkgp.co.in/

The link is only accessible on a Chrome browser. Please sign up before proceeding to the test and read all the instructions carefully. The deadline for this test is 10:00 PM on 6th August. Do attempt it before the same.

Eligibility: UG & PG first years
Date: 7th to 11th August 
Time: 6:00 to 8:00 PM
Venue: V2 (7th & 8th August) | V3 (9th-11th August)

In this internship season, we all have a dream company in our mind. A place where we want to be in the upcoming summers. But with all these thoughts, there are a ton of doubts and unresolved queries as well.To help you land up in your dream company this summers, Communiqué IIT Kharagpur is conducting an internship seminar targeting pre final years.

Date - 4th August
Time - 6 pm onwards
Venue - Vikramshila V4

Get all your queries answered by the seniors who already have done their internships in these companies and clear the air.

Please come on time as the presentations will go with the schedule mentioned in the poster.
